intro: Sabazia palmeri var. lancifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sabazia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous structure and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant features slender, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered pink or white flowers. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and desert scrub habitats. Its botanical structure supports its adaptation to harsh, dry climates, making it a resilient species in its native range.
